commit.message:
fix handling cursor_shape_manager

previously, cursor_shape_manager was not handled and registered, which
can lead to slurp incorrectly loading the entire cursor theme, despite
the compositor supporting cursor_shape_manager

Add example how to select windows without border under Sway (#150)

This is useful for screenshots. The previously present example is
simpler, but unsuitable for screenshots as it results in pictures with
border on three sides (i.e. top side doesn't have border). This
doesn't look well.

Add example how to select windows without border under Sway (#150)

This is useful for screenshots. The previously present example is
simpler, but unsuitable for screenshots as it results in pictures with
border on three sides (i.e. top side doesn't have border). This
doesn't look well.

commit.message:
Update required version of wayland-protocols to >1.32

To build this project, you must have the staging/cursor-shape protocol
which was added in 1.32.
Implement wp_cursor_shape_v1
extract cursor state initialization

build: move to `meson setup build` command

Related: https://github.com/mesonbuild/meson/pull/10701
readme: add link for IRC channel
build: bump version to 1.4.0
build: drop intermediate protocols static library
build: simplify protocol paths
build: use wayland-scanner pkg-config file
build: stop using sh for scdoc generation
build: pass string directly to include_directories kwarg
build: drop unnecessary files() call

Print output local coordinates

The new format options '%X, %Y, %W, %H' will present the same property
as their lower case counterparts but are all with respect to the top
left corner of the selection. x and y coordinates are relative to the
top left corner of the output on which the selection starts.
If the selection spans over multiple outputs the width and hight will
be cropped to the intersection with the output.
Fix busying the buffer

Add option to enforce a specific aspect ratio of the selection (#77)

* add option to enforce a specific aspect ratio of the selection

* Chck that aspect ratio is well defined

* Improvements to fixed aspect ratio

- Bounds checking on ratio input
- Use max instead of min to make selection with fixed aspect ratio more
  intuitive.
- Allow setting a fixed 1:1 ratio whil holding the shift key.

* Add description of keyboard controls to man page

Co-authored-by: Thayne McCombs <astrothayne@gmail.com>

committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1643215376 -0700

Add option to enforce a specific aspect ratio of the selection (#77)

* add option to enforce a specific aspect ratio of the selection

* Chck that aspect ratio is well defined

* Improvements to fixed aspect ratio

- Bounds checking on ratio input
- Use max instead of min to make selection with fixed aspect ratio more
  intuitive.
- Allow setting a fixed 1:1 ratio whil holding the shift key.

* Add description of keyboard controls to man page

Co-authored-by: Thayne McCombs <astrothayne@gmail.com>

commit.message:
render: Allow the user to specify which font family to use

User can pass the `-F` option and specify one of standard CSS2 generic
font family names. It'll default to the sans-serif family if not
specified and only be visible in combination with the `-d` option.
Render dimensions with same color as border

Use cairo_scale instead of multiplying by the scale everywhere

Fixes #93

verification.payload:
tree 098058712d541ee5570ca3a9fb92704a316f788f

Use cairo_scale instead of multiplying by the scale everywhere

Fixes #93

Fix #86.

* Do not set has_selection to true when -r is passed

commit.message:
Mark moved-away from outputs as dirty (#89)

* Mark moved-away from outputs as dirty

Just like how pointer_handle_motion mark the old state as dirty,
pointer_handle_enter should also mark the old state as dirty.
This fixes #87.
Not sure whether leave or enter is preferred, but enter seems nicer
because that's closer to where the state is changed.

There is still a race condition left, although it's very unlikely to
happen:
1. handle_motion or handle_enter is called. The current selection is on output A.
2. The output A is marked dirty
3. render() is called async, and handles the redraw of A, using the old
   selection.
4. render() marks A a clean
5. move_seat is called from handle_motion or handle_enter. This updates
   the selection to point to output B and B is marked dirty
6. B will be redraw on further events, but A will forever remain in a

* Remove unnecessary TODOs

parent 04945facb2f16ab212bbe7069908b850f654b9fa
author Ragnar Groot Koerkamp <ragnar.grootkoerkamp@gmail.com> 1623165306 +0200
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1623165306 +0000
